page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY, RYTON.
page.content: On Friday, 28 June, 1985, Councillor Cowans came to talk to us about the history of our village, yton. He told us about the "Tumulus" which is thought to contain the body of a chieftain. During the 1926 General Strike local people had to dig for their own coal. Whilst digging,a canoe from 8-9000 BC was found.It is now in the Blackgate Museum, Newcastle. The{pinfold}is the oldest relic in Ryton Village.Stray animals were kept in here. The pinfold is known in other areas as a penfold or pound. The man who looked after the animals was called the pounder. In the{Boldon Buke both the pinfold and the mill in Ryton are mentioned. About twenty years ago the original mill stones were used as foundations for a road.
